title: Chinese on OCE
body: I'm fine with people from other countries playing on our server but it's F***ing annoying how some Chinese will abuse you saying "Cao ni ma" and Other offensive words, Yet if an English person were to say it they would get Chat Restriction. Not to mention when you get in a ranked champ select half the team doesn't even speak English making you dodge. Riot do something about this please.

Oh yeah, another tea-party.

Seriously though, do you get banned for saying "fk you"? No you won't. Similarly, if you're triggered by a mere "cao ni ma", which is the Mandarin equivalent of the term, then you're probably just overreacting. Expecting the players who speak in the language you're not too familiar with to be absolute saints or else you'll report them or whatever is a bit extreme isn't it? That said, I'm all for universal chat filter, where it at least includes the general ****s in all languages supported by the league client, as currently it seems to only apply to English foul words which could definitely use some work.

Also, not speaking English is never a reason to report or ban, it's the refusal to communication that earns it, which has nothing to do with whatever language the person behind the monitor speaks. A person has to show that they are ignoring _most to all_ or even _actively_ sabotaging team communication (including pings) to be qualified as a case of refusing to communicate, otherwise the stance isn't really valid. And one shouldn't force the server's official language onto the playerbase either, as it just doesn't work that way.

But aye.

Literally, yes it means "fk your mum", but contextually, it's no different from English's "fk you", hence why it's a "Mandarin equivalent". But even if we ignore context, I don't think it's instant 14 ban or perma ban on English servers considering it's not like it's really serious according to English-speaking countries' views (considering the prevalence of mummy insults and "yo mama" jokes); that's a bit of an overreacting claim tbh. Unless we're talking about South Korea/KR server though, where it's seen as a capital insult there, or so I heard anyway. At most, that level of insult around here gets a chat ban (or 1 level up from your current phase) if you spam it again and again and again or something like that really.

That said, again, Riot should update the profanity filter to cover insults from other languages and not just English, that would do it fine.

Okay first of all I am Asian, and secondly I've seen this same type of thread before. I get it that some Asian people can be annoying 

I may be mis-interpreting it but when you said "I'm fine with people from other countries playing on our server" I see no difference if some Asian people can be that aggressive in context of what you have given us compared to any other people from different servers coming to the OCE server and acting the same way insulting players in their language- there is no difference if anyone with different cultural background acts the same way.

Individual's behaviour -Its more over to the fact of Individual's behaviour. There can be some individual Asian's who react in a humane way and resolves things in an orderly and calm method whilst others can act aggressively.

Don't be sensitive over it - Even for me I don't understand most of the Chinese language (I was born in an country as English is the first language which I learned to took as my first language) as long as you don't understand then just block/mute or if you just can't then just ignore it. 

And to the other people who just are very sensitive about it - Oh.. Just grow up like seriously your both across the world behind a screen; if this bothers you then just cut off your internet and think about how your gonna deal with people like this in reality. 

Overall, regardless of whether its Chinese of not. Its the individual.
